location.address: 65 Barclay Court, Blackrock, South Co. Dublin

description: Janet Carroll Estate Agents are delighted to present this superbly located and beautifully presented home which offers its new owners unrivalled lifestyle. Within a few minutes stroll of the centre of Blackrock Village, premier schools, child friendly Carnegie library, newly refurbished shopping centres and the DART.  A semi-detached home measuring circa 1089 sqft/101 sqm, number 65 is beautifully presented throughout. It was originally designed as a 4-bedroom property, but the owner has altered the footprint to create 3 superb luxurious bedrooms. This work could be easily reversed in order to reinstate the fourth bedroom. Number 65 is not overlooked at the rear and enjoys a beautiful skyline. The rear garden overlooks Rockfield park and tennis club. Barclay Court is a mature area and central to Blackrock Village, schools and a multitude of transport links. Its proximity to the sea front, public transport links to the city, Blackrock, Monkstown, Dun Laoghaire and Stillorgan offers immeasurable educational, cultural, dining and lifestyle opportunities. There is a vast well-maintained Rockfield park, with pedestrian access, playing fields, tennis courts, scenic walks and a multitude of sporting grounds for residents to enjoy. The beautiful Blackrock Park is only a few minutes stroll away.Some of South County Dublin's finest schools are within walking distance, from nursery school to UCD Smurfit business campus, DART to Trinity or the number 4 bus to DCU. Carysfort and Holly Park national schools, Newpark Comprehensive, Blackrock College, Sion Hill and St. Andrew's International school to name just a few.  An opportunity not to be missed. Viewing is strongly recommended. SPECIAL FEATURES- Secluded low density cul de sac- C. 1089 sqft/101 sqm- Turnkey condition- Semi-detached- Originally 4 bedrooms, converted into 3 larger ones - Off street parking for two cars- Oil fired central heating- Fitted carpets, light fittings and kitchen appliances as listed are included- Close to the sea- Short walk to the DART - Air coach stop to Dublin Airport close by- Close to the N11, QBC bus corridor - Stroll of Blackrock & Frascati shopping centres- On the outskirts of Blackrock village- Walking distance of Monkstown- Parks and coastal walks- Crèches close by- Pedestrian access to Avondale Park & Tennis courts - Superb choice of schools close by (walking distance)EDUCATION- Carysfort National School - Hollypark National Schools- Booterstown National School- Willow Park Junior School- All Saint's School- Blackrock College- Dominican College Sion Hill- St. Andrew's International School- Newpark Comprehensive- Scoil Lorcáin- CBC Monkstown- Coláiste Íosagáin and Coláiste Eoin- Lycée Français d'Irlande International School- Choice of crèches and Montessori schools- UCD Smurfit Business School- Blackrock Further Education Institute (BFEI)- Cycle lanes to UCD, direct bus to DCU & DART to Trinity CollegeACCOMMODATION  Entrance Hall: c. 4.65m x 1.86m (inclusive of w/c)Fitted carpet.Guest WC: Wash hand basin, w/c, extractor fan.Living Room: c. 4.91m x 4.01mThis room oozes comfort. A laminate floor not only looks the part but is hard wearing too. A multifuel inset stove is a fabulous addition and the crackling fire will no doubt provide a wonderful ambience when resting after a busy day.Dining Room/Playroom/Den: c. 3.62m x 3.04mDouble doors lead to this room and it provides great versatility. Currently in use as a music room it will suit many as there is a door to the kitchen meaning those with children can have a safe play space near them.Kitchen: c. 3.62m x 2.96mThis kitchen has plenty of wall and floor units, with stainless steel sink under a window that looks into the garden. Creda oven, Electrolux induction hob and extractor fan. Laminate floor. Door to the rear garden.UPSTAIRSLanding: c. 3.44m x 2.04mLinen storage press. Access door to the attic, pull down ladder with ample storage.Bedroom 1: c. 3.49m x 5.97mThis was originally two bedrooms, but the owners cleverly created a large suite that is almost akin to a hotel room! There is scope for furniture or fitted cabinetry should one desire. Laminate floor and fitted wardrobes.Bedroom 2: 3.62m x 3.04mFitted sliding wardrobes and fitted carpet. Window to the rear with views of the park.Bedroom 3: c. 2.65m x 2.00mFitted carpet and fitted wardrobe. Window looking into the back garden.Bathroom: c. 1.60m x 3.62mThis has been recently refurbished to create a large shower space framed by contemporary colour tones. Tiled floor, stainless steel heated towel rail, wash hand basin and w/c. The shower benefits from a rain head shower. This room is both contemporary and practical.OUTSIDETo the rear, the garden is not overlooked and has the park behind it. A fabulous asset to have on your doorstep. There is also a brickwork storage shed that houses the oil tank. A side gate provides access to the front of the house. The garden measures circa 30 feet by 20 feet. Ivy with a deep red hue sits on top of the shed and is simply stunning in these Autumn months. To the front there is off street parking.The road in front of the house has parking meters to prevent long term parking, as it is so close to the DART and the village. Only residents typically park on the road now which makes the cul de sac very quiet and residential. Disc parking is available on street for a nominal fee per car per annum.DIRECTIONSFrom Stillorgan dual carriageway, turn left onto Newtownpark Avenue. Continue along this road. Then turn left onto Temple Road/N31. Continue for approximately 290m. Then turn left onto Barclay Court. Turn right and then turn left. The house is on the left-hand side.BER DETAILSBER: D2BER No: 111459202Energy Performance Indicator: 265.58 kWh/m²/yrVIEWING By appointment with Janet Carroll at 087 4002020 or 01 2882020

description: This superb 4 bedroom family home has been extended and enhanced and offers unrivalled space, ideal for a growing family. Having been well maintained and upgraded, with a large extension to the side and rear creating a double fronted home, the house ticks box upon box for potential buyers, with fantastic space on the ground floor offering well proportioned reception rooms, a family friendly layout and cleverly designed accommodation over two levels.On entering the hall door there is a spacious family room on the left and a living room to the right with double doors through to the open plan, modern fitted kitchen/dining room, a large utility room and downstairs wc. Upstairs the bedrooms are all good sizes, with the main bedroom taking in the old third bedroom, creating a spacious main bedroom suite, with fitted wardrobes and ensuite, whilst across the hall two double bedrooms share a further shower room, with the family bathroom also on this level with one more double bedroom. Part of the attic has also been converted (with a pull down ladder) and creates an ideal office area or den for older children. There is ample parking to the front and an easily maintained enclosed garden at the rear.The location is excellent, set within a pleasant, sylvan development of similar homes, positioned at the foothills of the Dublin Mountains, there is a large open green to the front of the development with mature trees and the Owendoher River which meanders all the way to the Dodder, all adding to the feeling of space and tranquility. Located just off Edmondstown Road, within a short distance of both Marley and St Enda s parks and within walking distance of shops at Taylors Lane. description: "Oriel "is one of the finest family homes to come to the Clontarf market in recent years.It is a breath taking home of outstanding quality showcasing all of the grandeur, elegance and grace of period architecture yet with all the modern conveniences of a new home.Built just ten years, the meticulous attention to detail is a truly remarkable achievement as exacting standards and superior materials used are testament to its ageless appearance today. It is simply flawless in every way. At c.3650 sq ft (c339. Sq mt) this impressive home features luxurious versatile accommodation, perfectly balanced over three complete floors.Elegant high ceilings, Irish crystal chandeliers, solid mahogany & painted oak doors furnished with crystal handles, ornate period cornice and centerpieces , twin brushed Nickel 'Chesney of London' fireplaces set in Italian Carrara Marble, bespoke oiled and smoked wide plank oak floors, Natural Italian Travertine stone, and honed Crema Marfil marble are just some of the notable features that delight the eye. The natural light from its sunny south facing orientation fills every internal space while large folding doors offer the choice of open or compartmental living in genuine splendor. The rear garden is designed and landscaped in a contemporary "town garden" style , this outside space enjoys a warm sunny aspect ideal for entertaining & relaxing in sheltered comfort.Inside comprises a fine reception hall leading to a magnificent drawing room with a beautiful bay window and tall double doors to a sumptuous family room. From here, a second set of folding doors open to the sitting room which adjoins the open plan kitchen dining room across the rear. The chic fitted kitchen is smartly finished with integrated Neff appliances including a steam oven and a gourmet coffee maker in addition to the usual fair. A pantry and utility room, cloak room & guest wc are all perfectly appointed.Upstairs on the first floor is the fine master bedroom with its extensive walk-in wardrobe and shower room ensuite. Bedroom 2 is an impressive double bedroom with its own ensuite shower room and built in wardrobes and Bedrooms 3 is equally generous with built in wardrobes also. The fourth bedroom is a fine double bedroom next to the main bathroom and the linen press is suitably sized for a home of this scale.The top floor is full of surprises as bedroom 5 is the largest of all with a lounge area, ideal for those working from home or for an independent eldest child ! Bedroom 6 is another generous double bedroom, currently used as a walk in dressing room. Both of these bedrooms, along with the study and reading area are well serviced by the generous well-appointed shower room. also located on this floor. Access to ample eaves storage is available.Side entrances on either side and ample off street parking for several cars is available within the electric gated forecourt to the front. Rear French doors open onto a paved granite patio and hardwood deck inset with evergreen trees and a cascading water feature - an ideal place for morning coffee or evening wine. This fine sized  "town garden" enjoys a perfect warm sunny south facing aspect and is an ideal space for simply relaxing or outside entertaining.The enviable location is incredibly convenient with nearby shopping at Vernon avenue and an extensive choice of restaurants, cafes , bars , and schools all within a short walk. The seafront promenade is a pleasant stroll from here and the location benefits from convenient transport links and proximity to the eastpoint business park, the IFSC and Dublin's city centre & Dublin Airport.Sport & recreation is well catered for with 3 golf courses, an extensive beach with a variety of water sports and activities, a bird sanctuary, sports stadiums & concert venues nearby, Rugby club & cricket grounds within a stones throw, St Anne's Rose Garden & Park all just a few minutes away. location.address: 36 Orwell Gardens, Rathgar, Dublin 6, South Dublin City

description: AccommodationNo. 36 Orwell Garden`s is a three-bedroom mid-terraced property comprising approximately 98 sq.m. / 1,055 sq.ft of well-proportioned accommodation. The property is presented in excellent condition throughout with the benefit of a spacious contemporary open plan extension to the rear of the house, providing the ideal living space to cater for the modern family`s needs and will undoubtedly have a huge appeal to any incoming occupier. The modern fully fitted kitchen features shaker style units and has space for a large dining table. Double doors lead out into the south facing rear garden. In addition, there is a spacious sitting room with an open fire and period fireplace. An opaque glass block window from the utility room give this room lots of light. The utility room has a combi boiler and space for a washing machine. There is a WC under the stairs. Upstairs there are three bedrooms (2 doubles and 1 single) including the master bedroom and en-suite. Both double bedrooms have built in storage, with the family shower room being fully tiled.The attic is insulated and floored and provides ample space for storage.The house was completely renovated 5 years ago. OutsideSet back from the road, 36 Orwell Gardens sits on a spacious site providing off street parking for two cars to the front of the house. The back garden is paved. This wonderful outdoor space provides ample space for enjoying al fresco dining. The back of the garden is bordered by mature trees and woodland offering great privacy.  Location & AmenitiesRathgar has earned itself a reputation of being highly sought after given the many fine period houses in the area, much of which lies in an architectural conservation area. The village of Rathgar boasts a host of small independent stores and boutiques, speciality food shops, cafes and artisans all of which add to the local charm and appeal. Located just three kilometres from St. Stephen`s Green it is a reasonable commute to the city centre making this a popular choice for those working in the Central Business District.Orwell Gardens was built in the late 1930`s and now provides for a small enclave of houses conveniently located in a tranquil setting in the valley of the Dodder River off Orwell Road. As such it has long been a location of choice for first time buyers or buyers looking to buy, at an affordable level, into the location in which they grew up. Dartry Park is on your doorstep with its majestic trees and large green area. Sporting enthusiasts enjoy being within easy reach of Milltown Golf Club and both Rathgar and Brookfield Tennis Clubs as well as LA Fitness. The David Lloyd Sports and Fitness Centre at Riverview is also just a short drive away. Transport is well serviced by direct bus routes into the city as well as the Milltown LUAS stop. description: This is an appealing bay windowed four bedroomed semi-detached family home of 134 sq. m. (1,442 sq.) approx. plus garage, nicely situated on this popular and sought after residential road within the heart of Churchtown.  There are walled gardens and generous off street car parking to the front.Built in the mid 1950's there is a solidness in this that is difficult to replicate in modern homes of today with rooms of good proportions with large windows ensuring the accommodation is airy and light filled.  Though in need of modernisation, this long time family home has all the attributes to make this a really special home. Extended to the rear at ground floor level there is further potential to extend a(subject to P.P.) if required.The location is one of great convenience, with an enviable range of amenities at hand; within easy reach of the LUAS at Windy Arbour which makes light work of the short commute to the city centre and close to regular bus routes to the city and beyond. Local shopping is well provided for at Churchtown and all the leisure and shopping facilities of the much acclaimed Dundrum Town Centre are within walking distance. description: Lothlorien is a newly built state of the art 4 bedroom dormer bungalow located on a site of approximately 0.18 acre, located on Mart Lane just off Westminster Road, arguably Foxrock`s premier road.The well-proportioned accommodation extends to approx. 227 sq. m / 2,440 sq ft. and comprises a large inviting entrance hall with staircase opening through double doors in to a stunning open plan kitchen / dining / family room with a southerly orientation overlooking the back garden. The stylish kitchen features painted wooden units with soft close doors, under cabinet lighting and stone worktops while sliding doors open on to the patio. The branded appliances and brushed stainless steel sockets complete the kitchen. Adjacent is a utility room, which is plumbed for a washing machine and dryer, and has access to the side of the house. Off the hallway and linking in to the living room is a more formal reception room featuring recessed LED lighting and an energy efficient stove for added warmth and comfort on long winter nights. There are four double bedrooms, two at ground floor level, one featuring a walk in wardrobe and direct access to the family bathroom. The bathroom is fully tiled and has all polished chrome ware. Upstairs there are two further double bedrooms, the front bedroom benefiting from a walk-in wardrobe and spacious en-suite while the back bedroom overlooks the garden and also has an en-suite. Finishes All the windows and external doors are Nordan High Performance Alu-clad.Air to water heat pump central heating system to radiators with thermostatic zoned heating. Wood effect tiles in the kitchen, hallway and utility room. Low energy recessed LED down lighters to kitchen, bathroom/en-suite, WC and utility room. Telephone and Data cabling to living room and bedrooms.ExteriorTo the front of the house, there is a video access system to gain entry to the property and off street parking for numerous cars. The back garden is laid out in a mixture of paved patio off the kitchen, lawn with shrubbery and has a shed at the end of the garden. LocationExceptionally well located approximately 12KM from St Stephen`s Green and only a short stroll from Foxrock Village. This charming Village has a selection of popular eateries, restaurants and specialist food shops serving this upmarket suburb. The Magic Carpet Centre, a modern purpose built neighbourhood centre consisting of six retail units, on Bray road is 5 minutes` walk away. For more extensive shopping facilities, Dunnes Stores at Cornelscourt and the Park Retail Centre are close by. Foxrock Golf Club is a short distance away as is the driving range at Leopardstown Golf Club and Carrickmines Croquet and Lawn Tennis Club. An excellent selection of schools are nearby such as Hollypark Boys and Girls National School, St. Brigid`s Boys and Girls National School and many of South County Dublin`s Secondary Schools to include Blackrock College, Mount Anville, Loreto Foxrock, Lycée Français d`Irlande, Nord Anglia International School and St. Andrew`s College are just a short commute away. Cabinteely Park with its 96 acres of parkland and large children`s playground is also nearby. location.address: 17 Idrone Terrace, Blackrock, South Co. Dublin

description: Janet Carroll is delighted to offer Number 17, Idrone Sur Mer, for sale by Private Treaty. A wonderful opportunity to purchase a period gem in one of the most sought-after sea front locations in South Dublin. This super prime residential area is in the heart of Blackrock Village which is truly special. Deceptively large, it is superbly positioned on an iconic terrace of only 27 houses and enjoys panoramic views from sunrise to sunset over Dublin Bay. It retains the full original site with a south facing garden and rear access. The property has a very generous size but would lend itself to further development. Number 17 Idrone Terrace has been in the same family for a century and enjoyed by three generations. A 6-bedroom home measuring circa 295sqm/ 3,175sqft. In a metropolitan city such as Dublin this is a rarity. The property is in good condition and has benefitted from careful "behind the scenes" curation and maintenance. The roof has been very well attended to with new copper valleys and a high quality "fish scale" slate finish. This is often overlooked in homes of this vintage but provides superb peace of mind for discerning purchasers. The current generation of owners have taken every care to maintain the property in a fashion befitting this era.Number 17 is nestled in one of the best locations on the terrace and the views confirm this. Steps lead to a beautiful door which sets an elegant tone. The property is spread over three floors and is characterised by stunning period features, large open rooms with high ceilings, exquisite coving and large windows, not to mention the extensive sea views. Idrone Terrace is one of Blackrock most complete formal terrace of period houses. The 27 homes were built over a 20-year period, beginning in late 1840. An enviable location, the property lies between the sea and the Main Street of Blackrock, therefore enjoys a beautiful quiet coastline setting yet is minutes' walk to all the amenities that Blackrock has to offer including speciality shops, boutiques, cafes, bars, restaurants and expanding shopping centres. The DART station is only c. 300 metres away. With excellent schools nearby such as Blackrock College, Booterstown National School, Dominican College Sion Hill and St. Andrew's International School.This type of property does not come to the market very often in the area which is steeped in history and has carved out a niche way of living/ lifestyle for its residents. Viewing of this special period home is not to be missed.SPECIAL FEATURES- Beautiful sea facing mid terrace period property- C. 295sqm/ 3175sqft- Unrivalled sea views- 6 Bedrooms- Ceiling coving and roses- Fully replaced roof complete with copper valleys and fish scale slate finish- Two new Worcester boilers to improve energy efficiency- Conservatory- South facing rear garden with rear access- Development potential (SPP)- Unrivalled residential location with many amenities close by including seafront walks and bathing areas- Literally on the DART line, 3-minute stroll to Blackrock Park through the pedestrian entrance by the DART- Stroll to cafes and a growing number of new restaurants in Blackrock - Close to a choice of doctors' surgeries, dentists, boutiques, beauty salons, hairdressers, food outlets and pubsACCOMMODATIONGARDEN LEVELA small number of steps leads to the front door set underneath the stairs of the main house. Worcester Bosch upgraded boiler fitted circa 2 years ago increases energy efficiency along with Climote wireless controller (controlled via smart phone apps). This is one of two in the courtyard and greatly increases both energy efficiency and daily functionality. Many homes of this vintage do not have this type of forward thinking. There is an additional door in this space that contains a w/c which is plumbed. The second is housed in a brickwork storage shed/ boiler house in the same courtyard.MAIN HOUSEGROUND FLOOR Entrance Hall: c. 1.98m x 10.00m	Glass panelled double doors leading to the hall (doors fold open). Original hall door, a glass pane surrounds the door beckoning light from outside. This bounces off the feature light fitting in the hall and creates a warming tone to number 17. Note: Light fitting is not included in the sale.Drawing Room: c. 5.00m x 4.68m	Fitted carpet, original marble fireplace with brass/copper hood. Original service bells on the wall, upgraded double glazed sash windows. This is yet another detail of the careful thought put into the upkeep of this residence. A classically toned mint green provides the expected ambience of a room as grand as this. Double doors lead to the dining room where the palette flows and provides continuity. OUTSIDEThe front of the house is facing the sea. A pedestrian gate opens into a pathway that brings you to the steps of the house.  To the rear there is a circa 76 feet/23 meter long sun trap garden with the perfect orientation. It is south facing, private and has rear access. Apple trees and a mixture of mature planting provide a sense of privacy and special ambience to this lovely garden. Storage shed at the end of the garden. location.address: The Old Rectory, 1 Holmpatrick Terrace, Skerries, North Co. Dublin

description: The Old Rectory represents an outstanding opportunity to acquire a most elegant two storey over garden level Victorian residence of immense style and character enjoying an envious position on Lower South Strand in the heart of this charming and historic North Dublin town. A landmark property once occupied by James Hans Hamilton, the local Landlord later to be commemorated by the Hamilton Monument in Skerries, The Old Rectory enjoys the most spectacular views of Shenick Island, Church Island and, of course, Rockabill Island. This property also enjoys pedestrian access (across a small pathway) to the wonderful sandy beach and picturesque coast line. Is located in a prestigious and sought after residential location opposite Skerries Rugby Club. Approached by imposing stone steps the Victorian entrance porch leads to an impressive reception hall with feature staircase providing access to each of its three floors. There are two wonderful reception rooms on this level each enjoying many fine architectural embellishments of its era including magnificent fireplaces and high ceilings with ornate covings. The dining room to the rear enjoys spectacular views across the beach to Skerries Islands. There is also a large cloakroom off the hallway. On the upper floor, there are four spacious bedrooms together with family bathroom and the views from the rear bedroom, in particular, are spectacular. The garden level can also be accessed from the front of the rectory and benefits from an equally impressive hallway leading to a large family room at the front and fine oak fitted kitchen to the rear. There is also a spacious utility room and access to the private walled garden. The garden areas add great character to this historic property and the front graveled garden is bounded with typical wrought iron railings and strategically positioned shrubs and plants. The rear split level garden is mainly paved and bounded by attractive stone walls with pedestrian access to the wonderful sandy beach. There is also a large private side garden with newly laid lawn and patio area. To really appreciate this charming Victorian residence and all it s embellishments, viewing is essential.Entrance Porch 2.05m x 1.90m. description: No 81 is a wonderfully elegant home constructed circa 1900 and standing proud on this distinctive and picturesque Victorian Terrace on the corner of Elton Park and Albert Road.This is a splendid residence of exceptional appeal which the current owners have extended, remodelled and upgraded, using top quality finishes, to create a strikingly luxurious home of distinction. The generous floor plan offers a flexible and versatile layout that will appeal to all, with open plan areas ideal for entertaining and cosy spaces perfect for everyday living. The interior has been remodelled with great attention to detail resulting in an ultra-stylish home which still retains many of this period property s original features, including ceiling coving, fireplaces and working shutters, all of which complement the d cor throughout.On entering this fine home, one will automatically be impressed by what is to follow, with a spacious hallway with a honed stone floor and feature staircase with curved balustrade. To the front there is a spacious drawing room with sliding sash window and a feature fireplace. An open plan study is also located off the hallway with double doors opening out to an internal courtyard. To the rear of the property there is an impressive kitchen/dining room with a feature Stanley cooker and double doors opening out to the private rear garden and to the internal court yard. A guest WC completes the accommodation at ground floor level. The home s versatile layout is complemented by three equally generous bedrooms, two of which are fine doubles with one ensuite and a stunning family bathroom.Situated near the junction with Elton Park it is ideally located close to Sandycove Village which offers a host of services and amenities including excellent restaurants, shops and breath-taking coastal walks. Sandycove and Glenageary Dart stations provide ease of access to the city centre.Viewing highly recommended to appreciate the quality of accommodation and finish on offer.Garden:The front and rear gardens have been tastefully landscaped by Formality. The front garden is mostly lawned with a cobblelock pathway complimented by a cherry tree and a mature wisteria bordering the front door. The east facing rear garden is as impressive, tastefully designed and landscaped to offer a low maintenance and contemporary planting to conceal parking for one car. A paved patio with an electric canopy offers an ideal space for al fresco dining. description: REMAX Property Advisors are proud to present this superb newly renovated family home which has been thoughtfully extended in recent years with a spectacular extra large south-west facing rear garden. Laurel Cottage is a charming, spacious, bright and well presented three bedroomed detached home situated in a fabulous location with the convenience of being within a short walking distance of every imaginable amenity. It's now rare for a property like this to come to the market with all the requirements of contemporary living and having been completely refurbished throughout. Upon arriving at Laurel Cottage, you pass by the well-maintained front of the house laid down with lawn and patio which also has great potential to convert to a welcoming front garden. Making your way into the hallway you are greeted by a welcoming space that provides access to a bright family Sitting Room which overlooks the front of the house, it also leads to a spacious Kitchen cum Dining room which overlooks the lush green Rear Garden. The Hallway connects to all the principal rooms. The Living Room is fitted with a featured open fireplace, the Kitchen is fully fitted and comes with all mod cons. There is a guest WC that also serves as a second shower room. There are three spacious Double Bedrooms including a Master Bedroom en-suite. The south-west facing rear garden is extensively landscaped and comes with a convenient side access. The front of the property is installed with interlock tiles and has space for parking two cars. Laurel Cottage is ideally and most conveniently located close to Monkstown Village. Monkstown Village is renowned for having some of South County Dublin's finest restaurants, boutique shopping areas and bars. Transport is very accessible with numerous bus routes which run along Monkstown Road with the DART station at Salthill / Monkstown only a stones throw away allowing easy access to the city centre and surrounding areas. description: Register Now for Next Release Please visit our website at www.citywestvillage.ieThe Citywest story has reached an exciting new chapter. Davy Hickey Properties, who are the developers of the Citywest Business Campus over the last 25 years are now introducing Citywest Village a unique residential development of spacious A-Rated 3 and 4 bedroom homes inspired by the red brick streets of some of Dublin s oldest villages. The houses have been designed in the traditional Edwardian style with a full red brick elevation as well as many attractive features such as slate roofs, beautiful brick arches and granite cills. Citywest Village will comprise a range of townhouses, semi-detached and detached homes. Citywest Shopping Centre is very close by. Citywest Village is situated on the LUAS (Red Line) and a LUAS stop adjacent to the Village Green will be central to the development, providing easy access to Dublin City Centre. In addition, Citywest Village offers the convenience of being only a few minutes drive from the M7 and very convenient to the M50 and its main arterial routes. This will be another high quality development by Davy Hickey Properties to complement the adjoining world class Citywest Business Campus.The development will comprise spacious 3 and 4 bedroom family houses, the 3 bedroom houses ranging from approx. 109 sq.m / 1170 sq.ft to approximately 116 sq.m / 1245 sq.ft and the 4 bedroom houses will by approx.131 sq.m / 1405 sq.ft. All of the houses will be 2-storey. We invite you to register your interest in the development at www.citywestvillage.ie and we will keep you updated about the launch.

Meath in a historical area of natural beauty with commanding views over the countryside and where deer from nearby Tullog woods are regularly spotted roaming. It will not be uncommon for the purchaser to to wake up to the sight of deer on the lawn and so, it is difficult to imagine that this property is only 6 minutes from the M1 Motorway and 20 minutes from Dublin Airport.  'Saddler's Gate' boasts approximately 2,500 square feet of living space in addition to a large floored attic space of 600 square feet, which has been designed to be easily be converted into extra space. There is sufficient room for another dwelling on this property, to the east of the main residence, subject to obtaining planning permission. This may suit a family member who would be looking to build their own home in the future. Dating back to the mid 1800's, the Gate Lodge is situated at a former entrance to Herbertstown Estate which was known as Saddler's Gate and would suit a multitude of uses including tourist accommodation, Air BnB,use as a studio or a dwelling, all subject to obtaining the necessary consents. Choose your own kitchen and bathroom fittings with a €25,000 kitchen / bathroom allowance which comes included in the sale. location.address: Manderlay, 49 Slieve Rua Drive, Stillorgan, South Co. Dublin

description: Janet Carroll is delighted to present "Manderlay", 49 Slieve Rua Drive for sale by Private Treaty. This really is a tale of two houses. Originally bought in 2008, the vendors had plans for the original home (c. 1,500sqft/139sqm) and their ambition was to double the footprint whilst others would have infilled another house on the original site. Fast forward to 2012 and their dreams and ambitions had been realised. This stunning home now measures an impressive circa 3,089sqft/287sqm and absolutely nothing has been left to chance. The owners of "Manderlay" are never complacent and strive to make this home all that they wanted, even to this day. With 4 large bedrooms plus 2 attic bedrooms set over two floors this residence is built with love, style, practicality and most of all quality at its core.From the moment of entering number 49, you are met with handmade oak floors, doors and a custom handmade staircase. This is only a small element of the careful consideration the owners have put into this imposing South Dublin property. Not only are there multiple rooms for families to enjoy, they are all practical and would suit a multitude of purposes as a family's needs change over time.Location wise, this wonderful property is set in a mature, low density area with a swift access to the LUAS, M50 and Dundrum Town Centre as well as close to a host of amenities on its doorstep. Stillorgan Village Centre is nearby with several boutiques, shops, chemists, restaurants and cafes. It has really set itself apart as a food lovers haven, not to mention the formidable Donnybrook Fair. Further enhancing the location is the selection of much sought after junior and secondary schools nearby many of which are within walking distance. Viewing of this beautiful property is not to be missed.SPECIAL FEATURES- Super prime location in a mature family friendly setting- Fully renovated to double the footprint of the home to c. 3089sqft/287sqm- Highly energy efficient with upgraded boilers throughout- 4 large bedrooms plus 2 attic bedrooms- Oversized custom stove with back burner to heat water and radiators- Solid custom oak floors, doors, windows and architraves throughout (Lynch Joinery)- Custom solid oak staircase (Lynch Joinery)- Contemporary kitchen with fantastic storage throughout- Tile and timber flooring throughout for practicality- Off street parking for up to 8 cars- Newly renovated Stillorgan Village Centre nearbySOME OF THE LOCAL AMENITIES- Excellent public transportation links including the LUAS and QBC- Swift access to the M50- Stillorgan, Dundrum and Dundrum shopping centres- Montessori school and childcare facility- Mount Merrion park, sport pitches and tennis club- Cinema complex nearby- Very close to the recently refurbished Airfield in Dundrum - Communal green close by- Restaurants/cafés- Local farmers market- Kilmacud Crokes G.A.A. Clubhouse - Walking distance of Smurfit Business College & transportation links to UCD and TCDSCHOOLS- St. Laurence's BNS- Mount Anville primary and secondary schools- St. Benildus College - The Childrens House Montessori School- St. Raphaela's primary and secondary schools- Oatlands College- Short drive to Blackrock College, St. Andrews International School, Coláiste Eoin and IosagainACCOMMODATIONEntrance Hall: c. 3.87m x 2.00mBeyond the threshold of number 49, one is in no doubt as to the warm welcome you receive. This home exudes comfort. Porcelain tiles are bright and provide the perfect contrast to the warm wooden bespoke staircase that sets the tone. Guest WC/Shower Room: c. 2.66m x 3.12mThis is a wet room arrangement with anti-slip tiling. Contrast mosaic tiling on the walls. Wash hand basin, fitted vanity with inset lighting and w/c. The shower is mains, but the owners have upgraded their system to ensure strong power shower in all rooms at all times.Living Room: c. 4.26m x 3.87m This is a well-set room that can be separate to the kitchen if desired. Cleverly placed double doors allow it to be opened if entertaining as well. Solid oak floor adds a sumptuous warmth. Solid white marble fireplace with granite hearth. The marriage of dark and light colouring works well in this solid fuel fireplace. One cannot help but imagine sitting in front of a crackling open fire when the Summer weather is but a distant memory. There are two television points in this room for added versatility. A window to the front provides for natural light. Kitchen: c. 5.71m x 5.97mThe kitchen is the heart of most homes and is certainly the case here. This area is bright, open and practical to boot with fabulous storage as well. A large island draws your eye as you enter, and we have no doubt many cups of tea and conversations have been enjoyed here! The porcelain floor is continued into this space and provides for a light flow from the hallway. There are wall and floor units aplenty and even the most discerning chef or baker will be impressed. Twin carousels are neatly fitted at either end of the counter and provide for subtle storage that does not clutter the space. A larder drawer is another prime example of the thought process that went into this kitchen. Even the tone of grey on the cupboards works superbly in framing the room. A large American fridge freezer is perfect for growing families with hearty appetites. Electrolux induction hob, double oven and integrated dishwasher of the same quality brand. Three skylights are perfectly set above this space to maximise light throughout the day, which comes into its own in the Summer time. This kitchen is perfectly arranged for both family time and parties as required. It is a supremely adaptable space. In the corner of the room sits a large gas fireplace which provides instant heat and atmosphere. An upgraded boiler (30 kwh Idealogic) was fitted 10 months ago to maximise the output of power in this home as well as make it even more energy efficient.Double doors leading to the spacious living/dining room.Living Room/Dining Room: c. 6.16m x 7.03m This large room has a fabulous shape to it. Multi aspect lighting bounces off the solid oak floor. Superb for entertaining and the vendors have said this room is the first port of call for all football and rugby matches and with good reason! A standout feature in this room is the prominent brickwork that frames the stove. This is no ordinary stove as it heats both water and radiators and can be utilised instead of the gas when desired. The stove is custom fitted and has an oversized flue and is a fantastic asset to this home. The vendors made sure to think of any and every eventuality when renovating this property and each and every room is a testament to that. Another lovely feature is the solid oak mantel that rests above the stove and softens the profile of this part of the room. FIRST FLOORLanding: c. 5.07m x 5.14m (max)The handmade oak staircase was custom ordered for this house and continues the theme of quality that number 49 exudes."The Left Wing"Bedroom 1: c. 4.19m x 3.22mLaminate flooring with a window for natural light. As with all the rooms in this home they are very well proportioned.Bedroom 2: c. 3.86m x 3.46m (max)Laminate floor, window. Door to ensuite.En suite: c. 2.66m x 2.41mThis is a well set en suite and has features many would love. An integrated shower unit complete with sauna, foot spa, power jets and dual shower heads. It is a very clever arrangement that is perfect for unwinding in after a long day. The floors are tiled and a heated stainless-steel towel rail sits neatly on one wall. There is enough room for a dressing table as well which will no doubt please many. Wash hand basin, vanity unit, fitted mirror and w/c. Built in lighting and radio adds to the finishing touch."The Right Wing"Bedroom 3: c. 5.08m x 2.77mUpon entering one cannot help but notice that this room has three beds in it! This is to convey how spacious and practical this room is. Multiple electrical points, tv points and a window provides for natural light.Bedroom 4: c. 7.03m x 4.24m (max)Laminate floor for added durability with plenty of natural light. It is angled in such a way that one could fit clever cabinetry to maximise storage without imposing on the room itself. Door to ensuite.En Suite: c. 2.56m x 2.55mPartly tiled walls and floor, mains shower with superb adjustable pressure.Bathroom: c. 2.98m x 2.40mCeramic tiling, shower, freestanding bath with cast iron legs, w/c and wash hand basin. The custom oak frames the window and door which works well against the tiling.SECOND FLOORAttic Room/Bedroom 5: c. 5.00m x 4.74mA very spacious room with beautiful oak floors and three Velux windows that flood this space with light. This room is versatile and would suit both guests and teenagers alike as it is privately set. Door to ensuite.En Suite: c. 2.68m x 2.13mTiled floor and partly tiled walls, w/c, wash hand basin. As with all other bathrooms this too has a mains shower with tremendous power/pressure. Attic Room/Bedroom 6: c. 4.89m x 5.60mOak floor with prominent Velux windows cleverly place for natural light. Spotlighting creates a relaxing ambience for this sixth bedroom. Door to ensuite.En Suite: c. 2.20m x 1.83m Tiled floor, wash hand basin and w/c.OUTSIDETo the front, this property wraps around the site and follows the curvature of the road as you turn into Slieve Rua Drive. This creates an imposing residence that one cannot help but be impressed by. Wired for electric gates the driveway can manage up to 7/8 cars if needed. Raised planting framed with sleepers softens the space and one could plant mature hedging for additional privacy if so wished, but due to the orientation of number 49, it is not overlooked.To the rear is a bijou style garden. A clever mix of planting and stones has created a private oasis that the current owners use to its fullest, especially in these Summer months. They have cleverly placed raised fencing that close the garden off from the outside. Although this home is in a prime location, the rear garden allows for a sense of escapism.  Even the shed was beautifully painted to add a warming blue hue to the space.DIRECTIONSIf travelling from the city centre, on the N11 turn right onto Lower Kilmacud Road. Stay on this road. Turn left at O'Dwyers Pub. The property is the first on the right just before the junction.BER DETAILSBER: B3BER No: 111234753Energy Performance Indicator: 133.49 kWh/m2/yrVIEWING By appointment with Janet Carroll at 087 400 2020 or 01 288 2020

location.address: 7 Chelmsford Road, Ranelagh, Dublin 6, South Dublin City

description: Charming Victorian right in the heart of it!We take great pleasure in presenting this utterly charming and deceptively spacious Victorian residence to the market. The fabulous teal coloured door invites you to want to see more of this pretty Victorian residence and believe me this house won't disappoint. From the moment you enter this home it charms you with it's eclectic mix of furnishings and colours. The traditional layout with all original features intact and wide floor boards that have aged to a honey colour are stunning. The newly fitted kitchen with its dual aspect is light filled, tasteful and charming. The garden tells a similar story with stone wall, mature shrubs and planting and buckets of southerly sun. There's also scope to extend upwards and outwards to the rear. Plus it's Ranelagh, see you there!Upon entering No. 7 Chelmsford Road you are greeted by an impressive entrance hall with hidden guest w.c. under the stairs. Off the hall are two elegant reception rooms with generous proportions, original fireplaces and original timber flooring. The second reception room is further enhanced by pretty French doors which open onto the patio and garden. A cosy breakfast room overlooks the patio while a well equipped kitchen with dual aspect looks onto the mature and picturesque rear garden measuring 71ft  x  21ft .The original timber staircase leads upstairs where the first floor return boasts a very large bathroom - a perfect relaxation room with enamel bath and original brass taps as well as a separate free standing shower unit. At first floor there are three bedrooms, all beautifully complimented by original ceiling cornicing and sash windows. There is a substantial south facing garden to the rear with a raised garden lawn, a private patio area and well stocked flowerbeds . It also has the added bonus of rear pedestrian access. As for parking there are no shortage of options. Parking is on street disc parking and residents of No. 7 Chelmsford Road can park on Chelmsford Road, Chelmsford Lane, Chelmsford Avenue  and Leeson Park. As for it's location it's second to none. Located in the heart of Ranelagh No. 7 is within striking distance  of every conceivable amenity such as restaurants, gourmet food  shops and some of Dublin's finest schools. St Stephen's Green is just a 20 minute stroll and the Luas green line provides fast and reliable access to the city centre and suburbs. We look forward to showing you around No. 7 Chelmsford Road.

Number 16 Shelton Drive has been cleverly extended to the rear amidst its sun-drenched south facing rear garden. There is a spacious feel to the property the moment you enter its doors with an entrance porch, 3 large bedrooms downstairs, large open plan sitting/living room, extended kitchen/dining room, and a family bathroom.  There is a dormer attic ensuite bedroom upstairs and also boasts a large 4 car garage which has potential to further extend the property.This property is ever suited to a family looking to reside in one of Dublin's most sought after locations with the added benefit of the city on its doorstep.Situated off Shelton Grove, Rockfield Avenue & Kimmage Road West, the convenience of 16 Shelton Drive cannot be overstated located within close proximity of Terenure, Rathgar, Templeogue Village, Rathmines and the City Centre. description: Janet Carroll Estate Agents are delighted to present this deceptively large 3 bedroomed home measuring circa 1274.5 sqft/118.4 sqm in a quiet mature development off Mount Merrion Avenue. Number 95 has exceptionally high-quality finishes throughout. It was extended to the rear with a glorious conservatory to take advantage of the south west orientation and the beautiful surrounding granite walls.  The current owners of this lovely home have enjoyed it for 31 years and chose this one specifically. They have taken great care to create a beautiful home that one could sense is loved and enjoyed. French Oak parquet floor in the hall and sitting room lead to the rustically styled kitchen that looks into the garden that most would never know exists!The location is truly second to none and will appeal to a variety of people who want a super address without compromising on space. It will suit those seeking to "rightsize" from larger homes, young family as well as other discerning purchasers who long for a home in one of South County Dublin's premier locales. Surrounded by a host of amenities including a stroll to Stillorgan, Mount Merrion and Blackrock villages, the QBC with cycle lane, St. Vincent's Hospital and a superb choice of schools. Close to the N11 with swift access to the M50.Viewing of this wonderful property is not to be missed.SPECIAL FEATURES- Mature low-density development in prime location in Blackrock- Beautifully maintained throughout- 3-bedroom terrace- Deceptively spacious home in superb condition- Conservatory- Double glazed windows- French Oak parquet floor- South West facing garden measuring circa 80 feet long- Off street parking- Cul-de-sac- Low management fees of only €400 per year- Perfect for those rightsizing, downsizing or first-time buyers- Transport links nearby- Close to a host of amenities including tennis, bowling clubs, swimming pools etc- Walking distance to the DART - QBC to UCD, Dublin City Centre and Airport Coach stop- Close to Blackrock Clinic and St. Vincent's Hospital- Stroll to both Blackrock and Stillorgan shopping centres- Just off the N11 with swift access to the M50- Park and coastal walksEDUCATION- Carysfort National School -Booterstown National School- Willow Park Junior School- Blackrock College- Dominican College Sion Hill- St. Andrew's International School- Hollypark National School- Scoil Lorcáin- CBC Monkstown- Coláiste Íosagáin and Coláiste Eoin- Lycée Français d'Irlande International School- Choice of crèches and Montessori schools- Michael Smurfit UCD Business School- Cycle lanes to UCD, direct bus to DCU & DART to Trinity CollegeACCOMMODATIONEntrance Hall: c. 3.87m x 2.10mFrom the outset the theme of quality is evident with the beautiful textured French Oak parquet floor in the entrance hall.Guest W/C: The parquet floor is continued into this room. Wash hand basin, w/c and a classically styled porthole window adds a nice touch.Sitting Room: c. 4.80m x 3.87mThis room is warm and inviting. The parquet floor provides a touch of luxury and is complimented by the solid fuel fire and ornate marble mantel. This contrast in materials works well and will no doubt appeal to those who enjoy a crackling fire on cool evening after a busy day. A subtle wooden panelled archway leads to the dining room. One could place doors here to separate the rooms should they wish but it works very well in its current form.Dining Room: c. 3.56m x 3.03mThe French Oak parquet floor flows into this room as well and provides for continuity and presentation. Door to the kitchen and double doors to the conservatory. Note: Chandeliers and Carriage Lamps are not included in the sale.Kitchen: c. 4.49m x 2.95m White tiling in a rustic tone partly covers the walls. There are wall and floor units aplenty with a stainless-steel sink and a window with a view of the garden. Smeg double oven and electric hob, Miele fridge freezer and Bosch washing machine. Tiled floor, tiled splashback. Door to the conservatory.Conservatory: c. 4.03m x 3.85mThe conservatory was added 20 years ago and is invaluable in providing not only an additional space to enjoy but to capitalise on the superb orientation of the South West facing garden that measure circa 80 feet in length. Canadian maple wood adorns the floors and wood panelling on the ceiling adds a warming tone. The current owners have a stunning baby grand piano that they enjoyed playing for many years which gives a great sense of the lifestyle enjoyed over the past 30 years.UPSTAIRSLanding:Hot press with tank, access to the floored attic, perfect for storage.Bedroom 1 (Main): c. 3.45m x 3.67mFitted carpet, clever built in wardrobes and window to the rear garden. En Suite: c. 1.99m x 2.30m Contemporary tiled walls contrast the floor tiles finished in a marine blue hue. Fitted medicine cabinet with mirror, wash hand basin, w/c, step in shower with mains. Bathroom: c. 2.74m x 2.91mThis is a well-proportioned bathroom with scope to adapt as one sees fit. Bath, tiled walls, wash hand basin, w/c, fitted medicine cabinet with mirror. An inset skylight provides for ventilation and natural light.Bedroom 2: c. 3.60m x 3.16mFitted carpet, built in wardrobe and a window to the front.Bedroom 3: c. 2.56m x 3.07mFitted carpet, built in wardrobe and window to the front.OUTSIDETo the front this property benefits from a brickwork drive with room for one car. The beauty of this low-density development is plenty of parking on the street which is a cul-de-sac. Mature planting sits on either side of the drive and provides additional privacy to the sitting room. To the rear is a garden most would never know exists! Measuring circa 80 feet long and circa 20 feet wide (max) this garden has been superbly cared for. There are multiple areas to sit which have allowed the current vendors to follow the sun around the garden depending on the time of day. location.address: 62 Beech Park Drive, Deansgrange, Blackrock, South Co. Dublin

description: Janet Carroll is delighted to present to the market this stunning detached, bright and spacious four-bed family home. It comprises c. 148sqm/1593sqft of beautiful living accommodation in a most tranquil and sought-after residential location in South County Dublin. This property is presented in turnkey condition throughout and is situated in a small family-friendly location that has family and lifestyle at its core. With superb road frontage, a luscious green on its doorstep, schools to suit all tastes and amenities to beat the band, number 62 Beech Park Drive, dare we say it, truly has it all. Beech Park is an attractive, highly sought-after residential location conveniently located within easy reach of the excellent amenities and shopping facilities of Foxrock, Blackrock, Cornelscourt and Stillorgan. Dun Laoghaire with its beautiful harbour, restaurants and marine activities is a mere ten-minute drive away. There are also a host of sporting activities in the surrounding area, including tennis (with a communal court only moments away), soccer, rugby, GAA, hockey, rowing and sailing. Some of the best schools in South County Dublin are all within easy reach, including Hollypark, CBC Monkstown, St. Brigid's, Lycee Francais d'Irelande and Willow Park Primary Schools.  Loreto Foxrock, St. Andrew's College, Clonkeen College, CBC Monkstown and Blackrock College secondary schools are also nearby.  The city centre is easily accessed on the N11 QBC (via pedestrian shortcut) or the nearby Luas Park & Ride in Sandyford, Carrickmines and Stillorgan, while the DART is available from Dun Laoghaire and Blackrock. This property offers the most convenient lifestyle in an attractive mature location. Viewing is highly recommended.SPECIAL FEATURES- Detached home in prime location- Mature residential location- 4 well-proportioned bedrooms- C. 1593sqft/148sqm- In turnkey condition throughout- New kitchen fitted circa 4 years- Solid timber floors- Newly fitted carpet- Two open fireplaces (one of which is covered)- Panelled doors- Gas fired central heating- West facing garden with planting and patio- Superb road frontage for privacy- Off street parking for 3 cars- Garage with internal door (potential to convert s.p.p.)- Perfect for families- Host of amenities nearby- Deansgrange Library around the corner- Super Valu, post office and FX Buckleys butchers nearby- Green and tennis courts moments away- Host of schools in the vicinity- Convenient to excellent schools and transportACCOMMODATIONEntrance Hall: c. 6.48m x 2.00mThe journey through this home actually starts from the gate. Once you see the carefully chosen oversized numbers declaring you have arrived at number 62, complimented by a beautifully painted teal front door and tiled step, you know this home has been cared for. The entrance hall is bright with original wooden flooring in a white ash finish warming the space as you enter. Living Room: c. 9.90m x 4.33mTo the left and accessed via glass panelled doors is the living room. The original white ash flooring is continued in this space providing continuity. A large window to the front of the house beckons light inside and as this home is set back from the road it is not overlooked. A classically tiled open fireplace creates a wonderful atmosphere following a long day of work. Thankfully this home has 2 of them. One can tell many an evening has been spent in front of the fire with loved ones.Dining Room/Family Room/Playroom: This room is set behind the living room and was originally partitioned by two sliding doors. The vendors cleverly decided to open it up and allowed it become part of the living room. This could easily be reconfigured if one so wished but it works very well. This space would make a fabulous dining room, family room or playroom as it is set off the kitchen. Its proximity means parents can keep a watchful eye on little ones from both the kitchen and living room should they so wish. A solid fuel fireplace is located here and is currently covered over but could be reinstated should one wish. Glass door to garden.Kitchen: c. 5.70m x 4.17mThe heart of every home where memories are made, not just meals. This kitchen is accessed via the hall as well as the family room. It was renovated circa 4 years ago and with great effect. With plenty of light and space this room would easily fit a family dining table or breakfast bar. A window frames the landscaped west facing garden and provides natural light. Tiled floor, shaker style wall and floor units for practical storage. Bush fridge freezer, New World/New Home gas hob with safety glass covering, extractor fan, classically styled sink and taps. Candy washing machine and Bosch dishwasher (all appliances included in the sale). This room is clean, crisp and practically laid out without compromising on character.Guest W/C: This guest w/c is located in the hall under the stairs. Wash hand basin, w/c, fitted mirror and frosted window.Garage: c. 4.88m x 2.65mThis garage is accessed both at the front via an "up and over" door as well as internally. The benefit of this is that the new owners have the opportunity to convert the garage into another living space should they wish (SPP). This provides for tremendous versatility as family needs change over time.UPSTAIRSAs one ascends the staircase they are met with a large window that measures circa 2.00m x 1.81m. This opens up the space and shines in natural light toward both the stairs and landing alike.Bedroom 1: c. 4.64m x 4.49mEach bedroom has a themed colour and this room is "opel green" by Fired Earth. Two windows frame this space and provide more light. Fitted carpet.Bedroom 2: c. 2.92m x 3.64mThe theme of this room is Amethyst and Gentian Violet. Fitted carpet, built in shelving and a window. Bedroom 3: c. 2.82m x 2.66mFitted carpet and window.Bedroom 4: c. 2.76m x 4.31mFitted carpet, window. This is a fun coloured room finished in pink.Bathroom: c. 1.85m x 2.40mLinoleum floor, bath with mains shower. A panelled wall frames the space and gives the room a classic touch which is quite endearing. Frosted window. Tiled splashback at the bath.OUTSIDEThe front of this house is set back from the road to provide off street parking for circa 3 cars. A redbrick paving frames the front of the house. A mature tree sits in the corner of the drive and cleverly provides privacy for the front room. Across the road is an open green area that is perfect for children to play on. Parents can literally see them from the front door of the home! There is also a tennis court moment away to be enjoyed. To the rear there is a beautiful west facing garden that has a patio area nestled at the back door. Well positioned raised planters provide a pleasing feature for flowers as well as separating the lawn from the patio. The garden is beautifully kept, and the family remember a fondness for hydrangea. This is a lovely space that allows children to enjoy playtime whilst under the watchful eye of parents in the kitchen.DIRECTIONSTravelling southbound along the N11 take a left turn onto Kill Lane. Take the first right onto Beech Park Road and continue to the end of the road. Turn left onto Beech Park Drive and the house is on the left-hand side opposite a green area.BER DETAILSBER: E2BER No: 100437862Energy Performance Indicator: 348.98 kWh/m²/yrVIEWINGBy appointment with Janet Carroll at 087 400 2020 or 01 288 2020

description: On open view Saturday 8th, 3.00-3.30pm.Savills are proud to present 4 Ulster Terrace to the market, a handsome semi-detached period home located on the outskirts of Blackrock.The property has a flexible interior with various different configuration options, depending on the new owner' s requirements. Ulster Terrace, was built in 1847 for British army officers and was designed to entertain on the main level with original granite steps leading up to the main entrance which anticipates the grandeur of the entrance hall. Here rich mouldings adorn the walls and ceiling A pair of plaster heads guard the arch below the main staircase which use brass rods to ornately fix the carpet. This grand effect continues in the two reception rooms on the main floor which are linked by folding doors. Both of which have fine ceiling roses and original fireplaces. The entrance is at the front and up a set of smart granite steps to the main front door. The hallway is magnificent and sets the tone for the proportions and general style of the house with high ceilings and beautiful period plasterwork. The living room is at the front and has a large bay window overlooking the front garden as well as a wood burning stove, wood floorboards and more detailed cornicing. The room has double doors to the rear, opening through to the kitchen / dining room which includes fitted units, space for a good size table and chairs and a window to the rear overlooking the back garden. There is a rear hallway as well as a large bathroom on this level, designed to serve the bedrooms on the floor above.The first floor landing has stairs rising from the main entrance level and doors to the master bedroom and bedrooms two and three. The largest of these rooms is the master bedroom which is at the rear and an excellent size. There is an attractive feature fireplace with pretty coloured tiling and plenty of space for a large bed and furniture. Bedrooms two and three are at the front of the house and enjoy a pleasant leafy aspect across the front garden. The lower ground floor can be accessed from the main entrance hall as well as via a separate door in to the front hallway, giving this level the potential to be used as a separate self-contained space if required. There are two large bedrooms on this level, one to the front and one to the rear as well as a sitting room/family room at the rear with access in to a useful WC and store space. The family room has a door to the side which gives the property access to the gardens. The outside space at 4 Ulster Terrace is terrific with large gardens at both the front and the rear as well as plenty of driveway parking, a garage and a useful study, accessed from the rear garden. The front has a smart lawn as well as a pebbled driveway leading to a block paved parking area as well as the garage. The rear garden is a lovely space and far larger than the average sized garden for this style of property. You will find a good sized granite paved patio area to the side which then leads on to further lawned gardens with a sunny southerly aspect.Blackrock is a large commercial and cultural centre with every amenity at its doorstep, including banks, cafes, restaurants, boutiques, hairdressers and barbers, shopping centres, pharmacies, supermarkets and art galleries. There are excellent transport facilities including the DART and numerous bus routes providing regular and convenient services to the City Centre. There is also a great selection of much sought after primary and secondary schools as well as colleges. 4 Ulster Terrace is particularly well placed for access in to the centre of Dublin as well as out of the city on the N11.Entrance Hall Door to the front, wooden floorboards, ornate ceiling plasterwork including detailed coving and centrepieces, beautiful archway with detailed plasterwork and Going Through The stained-glass front door (with intercom) opens into a generous entrance hall and hallway, with the very spacious (c. 22 sqM) sitting room with bay window to the right and the second reception (c. 16 sqM) or bedroom, study or workspace is to the left.  Past the guest WC and into a porcelain tiled dining area (c. 13sqM) with French doors onto the back garden, the kitchen (17sqM) is tiled of course and has 13 linear metres of cupboard space above and below the counter top with a built-in island unit along with a 5-burner gas hob, a fridge and a freezer. There is a superb utility room/prep area (6sqM) to the left, again porcelain tiled with cupboard space above and below the countertop with sink and a fridge freezer, dishwasher and washing machine and a side entrance. Up TopUpstairs the main bathroom (7sqM) is directly across the return, beautifully tiled with bath and shower and glass shower door. Our master bedroom (c. 16sqM) has a 6-door set of 'robes and has lots of space for the Queen-sized bed (1.8m x 2m) plus a c. 2.5sqM ensuite. The second bedroom is a delight - extra spacious (12.5 sqM) again with ensuite AND a walk-in wardrobe. Bedroom nr 3 is almost as big (12sqM) with a 4-door wardrobe setBedroom 4 (7sqM) easily accommodates a single bed and 2-door wardrobe set. This property is presented in move in condition. Its location is excellent, just 2 minutes from the M3 with fast access to the M50, Blanchardstown Shopping Center and the new Avoca are a couple of minutes' drive away, as are the range of Business & Corporate Parks and Blanchardstown Institute of Technology. Littlepace has its own schools and shopping area within walking distance and there are a range of primary and secondary schools within a short drive.

description: Located in a quiet cul-de-sac setting, with a south facing garden to the rear, this enviable residence comes to the market having undergone an extensive program of extending and refurbishment and now offers itself as a wonderfully appointed, light filled, contemporary family home with an abundance of both living and bedroom accommodation, where all the family s needs are met.A gated front garden with ample off-street parking, leads up to the smart double fronted fa ade beyond which lies a wealth of generously proportioned and impressively presented rooms, which are sure to tick every box for those looking for a something a little bit special.The entrance hall with guest w.c. leads through to the kitchen with extensive built in wall and floor units and in turn leads through to the extended living / dining room, an incredible heart of the house. The bright open space features two living areas and a dining area with wall to wall windows incorporating sliding doors leading out to a large deck and a private south facing garden. The room can also be accessed from the entrance hall, off which there is a further cosy living room. As you alight the stairs you come upon a newly fitted modern family bathroom, the principle bedroom and two further nicely sized bedrooms. A further stairwell leads from the landing up to the large attic conversion which is currently in use as a play area but could easily be used as a further bedroom with plumbing for an en-suite bathroom and has full planning permission for a dormer style extension, as neighbouring properties have done. The appeal of this home is further enhanced by its gardens to both the front and rear of the property. The front garden has ample off-street parking and access to the garage (23ft x 8ft), while to the rear of the property there is a 50ft south facing garden, bordered by mature trees and hedging, affording the discerning purchaser a great degree of privacy. Laid mainly in lawn, it also has a large deck accessed directly from the living area, giving it a feel of an extension of the living/dining room; a great area for summer entertaining and al-fresco dining.The property is positioned within easy walking distance of Dun Laoghaire, Monkstown, Glasthule and Glenageary, offering a wealth of amenities, both social and essential and is a short walk from new shops and cafes at Park Pointe in the Honeypark development. The main thoroughfare at Dun Laoghaire offers a vast of array of shopping opportunities with a local farmers market running every Sunday in The People s Park, while Monkstown village has an excellent selection of boutique shops, delicatessens and eateries. Some of South Dublin s finest schools and excellent pre-schools are nearby including Rathdown, Holy Child, Castlepark, Loreto Abbey Dalkey, Cluny and Monkstown Educate Together. There is easy access to the M50 and N11 road networks ensuring good commuter routes to the city and beyond. It is also just a few minutes walk to the 46 A, 75, 7 D and 8 bus routes.Entrance Hall Recessed lighting, laminate floorGuest W.C Tiled floor, wc, whb,Living Room 2.7m x 3.7m. No. 19 is a most deceptive family home measuring approximately 124 sq m / 1,335 sq ft of comfortable living and bedroom accommodation. Beyond the attractive faÃ§ade internally the property is presented to a high standard and there is a wonderful sense of space as one walks through the house. An entrance hall leads to a light filled reception room to the left, a large room to the right currently being used as a study (but can lend itself to a playroom or another bedroom) a downstairs bathroom and then to the rear there is a beautifully extended high-quality designed kitchen /dining room and lounge. Upstairs there are two double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a 2nd bathroom. The current owners completely upgraded and extended the property in 2013. It was fully insulated, plumbed and rewired. description: ***IMPORTANT: TO BOOK A VIEWING OR REGISTER FOR AN OPEN VIEWING CLICK BOOK VIEWING ON THE PROPERTY LISTING ON WWW.MOOVINGO.COM*** Moovingo is delighted to welcome to the market 40 Broadford Park, Ballinteer, a charming 3 bedroom semi-detached home in turn-key condition from a recent renovation and boasting 95 sqm / 1022 sq.ft of beautiful living space with well-proportioned rooms. This immaculately presented property comes to the market brimming with great features. With attractive low-maintenance front and rear gardens, it is surrounded on all sides by a wealth of amenities, local schools and transport links.Number 40 offers the discerning purchaser an opportunity to buy a walk-in family home in this mature residential community. Broadford estate has won the Tidy Districts competition nearly every year since 2012.The work done in 2012 brought the BER from G to C1 and makes running costs low, with triple-glazed windows, external wall insulation, a multi-fuel stove, attic insulation, a new boiler and new heating system. Everything you can see in this house is new along with a full electrical re-wiring, solid oak flooring downstairs and solid pine doors, all of which lend simple elegance and comfort to this home.The south-facing rear garden measures L 11metres x W 6metres approx. and has a high-spec granite patio, forming a private and southwest facing sun-trap, which becomes the perfect space for al fresco dining. There is an outside tap and a Barna shed for storage.ACCOMODATION:Entrance Hall (1.7m x 4.9m): Outdoor light, Munster Joinery ultra-tech timber/steel front door with frosted side-window, alarm panel, solid oak floors and recessed ceilings lights, boxed electric consumer board, doors to sitting room and kitchen.Downstairs W.C (0.8m x 1.54m): With white WC and corner WHB, tiled floor and part-tiled wall, extractor fan, recessed ceiling light.Laundry closet (0.75 x 0.7m): washer and dryer located here to improve kitchen functionality, recessed lightLiving Room (3.9m x 4.1m) 6KW multi-fuel stove which will heat entire downstairs, black marble hearth, TV and telephone points, double doors leading to....Dining Room and Kitchen (5.8m x 3.9m): With French doors opening out to south-facing garden, kitchen designed in ideal 3-sided layout, integrated fridge-freezer and dishwasher, solid oak worktops, 5-ring gas hob with extractor hood.Landing: Attic access hatch and pull-down stairs, shelved storage hot-press with foam-insulated hot water cylinder and shower pump, frosted window to side.Bedroom 1 (3.6m x 3.4m): Spacious double bedroom overlooking the front garden.Bedroom 2 (3.5m x 3.7m): Spacious double bedroom overlooking the rear garden with a walk-in wardrobe with shelving and rails, black-out blind.Bedroom 3 (2.2m x 2.7m): Single bedroom overlooking the rear garden with black-out blind.Bathroom (2.1m x 2.1m): White ceramic WHB, WC, chrome power shower matching heated towel rail, full white bath, fitted mirror, fully tiled walls and floor in unique design, frosted window to the side.Attic: light with switch on landing, partially floored, 300mm thick extra mineral wool insulation.AREA INFOThis location is second to none. Broadford is literally enveloped by amenities such as well-established schools (primary and secondary), churches, Meadowbrook gym and swimming pool, St Enda's Park, Grange & Stackstown golf clubs, Ballinteer St John's GAA Club, Supervalu Ballinteer, Nutgrove shopping centre, Lidl and the award-winning Dundrum Town Centre with its excellent shopping, eateries and cinema.Wesley College, Ballinteer Community School and a range of Primary Schools including Holy Cross, Taney and Scoil Naithí are also located nearby. Ticknock and the Dublin Mountains Way is a 5 min drive; Killiney beach is a 15 mins drive. The area is well-serviced by public transport with LUAS and Dublin Bus (14 and 16) providing seamless access to the city centre, while the M50 links you to Dublin Airport and surrounding counties.All in all, 40 Broadford Park is a fantastic family home in this peaceful and much sought-after residential neighborhood.
